Others: UEFA has fined Serbia, Albania, and is investigating Croatia for various incidents of bad conduct and nationalist slogans during Euro 2024.
Albania's striker Mirlind Daku was suspended for two games for leading fans in anti-Macedonian slogans.
Albania's football federation was fined €47,250 for fans lighting flares and fireworks, throwing beer cups, and a fan storming the pitch.
UEFA charged Albania €10,000 for fans displaying an Albanian map with its borders extending into neighbouring countries' territories.
Serbia was charged for displaying a nationalist banner during its game against England, featuring the territory of Kosovo above a slogan that said ‘No Surrender'.
